metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9021 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in PHP before 5.6.40, 7.x before 7.1.26, 7.2.xbefore 7.2.14, and 7.3.x before 7.3.1. A heap-based buffer over-read inPHAR reading functions in the PHAR extension may allow an attacker to readallocated or unallocated memory past the actual data when trying to parsethe file name, a different vulnerability than CVE-2018-20783. This isrelated to phar_detect_phar_fname_ext in ext/phar/phar.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9021` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.27
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.27
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.27
php-pear - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.27
php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.27
php5-cgi - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.27

No subscription required

criterions.comment: php5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.27').
